sourcesContent: /* eslint-disable react/prop-types */ import React, { Component } from "react" import axios from "axios" import moment from "moment" import { connect } from "react-redux" import accountIcon from "../../UserPage/Profile/img/account.png" import bookingIcon from "../../UserPage/Profile/img/booking.png" import paymentIcon from "../../UserPage/Profile/img/payment.png" import reviewIcon from "../../UserPage/Profile/img/review.png" import { Loading } from "../../../components/Loading/Loading" import { Background, ProfileWrap, Left, ListWrap, List, Icon, Link, Right, ReviewCard, Title, Date, Comment, Img, } from "./styles/reviews" class Reviews extends Component { constructor(props) { super(props) this.state = { myReviews: [], isLoading: true, } } componentDidMount() { const { userFirstName } = this.props axios .get(`http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v1/reviews/getMyReviews/${userFirstName}`) .then((response) => { console.log(response) this.setState({ myReviews: response.data.data.reviews, isLoading: false, }) }) } render() { const { myReviews, isLoading } = this.state if (isLoading) return Loading...üë©üèª‚Äçüíª return ( <> Profile Bookings Payment Reviews {myReviews.map((review) => ( {review.tourTitle} {moment(review.createdAt).format("DD.MM.YYYY")} {review.comment} ))} ) } } const mapStateToProps = (state) => ({ userFirstName: state.header.userFirstName, }) export default connect(mapStateToProps, null)(Reviews)
